nodes.speaker: The Hound

nodes.text: Your presence is no longer required. The matter is closed.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Consult the dossier. You'll find the relevant citations.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: You signed the transfer for Loyal. Your presence is no longer required, outsider.
nodes.speaker: Bureau Official

nodes.text: You seem to have forgotten the... no, it's irrelevant. This matter is closed.
nodes.speaker: Bureau Official

nodes.text: Returning? For an... urgent procurement? The Notariat can expedite the paperwork.
nodes.speaker: Notary Clerk

nodes.text: The office closes at six. I suggest you conclude your business.
nodes.speaker: Notary Clerk

nodes.text: So you weighed the value of confirming his dossier was flagged against the advantage of surprise. Very well.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Analyst

nodes.text: So I ask again: How can you be certain that eliminating this agent hasn't escalated the situation, exposing us to greater scrutiny from the Hexagon?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Analyst

nodes.text: What is wrong with you? Having Marchais transferred to the Hexagon won't bring Adjutant Blanc back.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Colleague

nodes.text: A joke, of course. I will deflect personal inquiries at every procedural opportunity.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Colleague

nodes.text: The pugilistic arts are not my terroir. I prefer a more... diplomatic touch. But very well, the procedure is yours.
nodes.speaker: Reluctant Functionary

nodes.text: For the record, while I maintain operational control, my precision... diminishes. The forms will reflect this.
nodes.speaker: Reluctant Functionary

nodes.text: Getting into the Hexagon just got a lot simpler now that the Notariat's audit is complete.
nodes.speaker: Municipal Guard

nodes.text: {To revelers splashing in the fountain}All right, citizens, the curfew is in effect.
nodes.speaker: Municipal Guard

nodes.text: The Notary nods, then a panel of the counter retracts, and a dossier rises from the compartment.
nodes.speaker: Notary

nodes.text: The Notary nods, takes a step back, then the entire countertop slides away. A dossier slowly rises from the opening, a faint scent of sealing wax trailing from it.
nodes.speaker: Notary

nodes.text: I understand you handled the Durendal matter. The Préfecture could have managed it internally.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Very well. Are there any other... irregularities to report?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: I'll ask again: are there any other matters requiring Préfecture attention?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: They appear to be operating an unauthorized labor procurement ring. The Préfecture's border logs also suggest it's become a primary crossing point for Hexagon enforcement squads.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: The report, please.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: In detail.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: I've been notified that your arrival coincides with certain... irregularities. Would you care to file a statement?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Communications Officer

nodes.text: Excuse me. That is Préfecture property. What is your authorization?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Communications Officer

nodes.text: This is the second time this week. The broadcast schedule is a matter of public record. Why must you interfere?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Communications Officer

nodes.text: A sub-optimal outcome, I concede. If only the Durendal protocols had been authorized a day earlier...
nodes.speaker: Mid-Level Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Considering I was working with a provisional mandate and a half-trained adjutant, it could have been worse. The paperwork alone nearly killed me.
nodes.speaker: Mid-Level Bureaucrat

nodes.text: I spent the next twenty years in administrative limbo. But I persisted, obviously — and eventually, I was promoted.
nodes.speaker: Mid-Level Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Clear the passage! Official business!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Agent

nodes.text: Merde alors!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Agent

nodes.text: Not without the proper forms!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Agent

nodes.text: You are obstructing a Préfecture agent!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Agent

nodes.text: This area is now restricted!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Agent

nodes.text: Gérard! Gérard, the papers!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Agent

nodes.text: Your business?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Bonjour.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: State your purpose.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: This area is restricted. Your authorization?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: We've processed you before.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Doctor.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: {Pneumatic tube thump}<Sound of document arriving>
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: Attention!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: Clear the corridor!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: I must file this immediately!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: Merde!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: {Startled gasp}
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: If the conscripts at the Southern Vineyards had better terroir, we'd still hold the border.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: They can barely fill out a requisition form.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Let them audit each other. It'll keep them occupied.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Incident logged. Préfecture intervention under review.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Incident has been logged. Reviewing protocol.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Ha! The paperwork alone will bury them.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Make your presence elsewhere. If you generate complications, my signature will not appear on your forms.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: As you say, Adjutant.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Please—the paperwork alone! Don't leave me with this dossier!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: My office hours are concluded.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Until the next audit.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Ensure your movements are properly documented.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Ah, there you are.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Enforcer

nodes.text: Very well. Let us proceed.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Enforcer

nodes.text: Hah. Another provincial.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Enforcer

nodes.text: Oh, a particularly stubborn one.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Enforcer

nodes.text: Target dossier: verified. Reinitiating hostile protocols.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Enforcer

nodes.text: Hostile subject confirmed. Dossier verification: complete.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Enforcer

nodes.text: I hear the Hexagon is mobilizing against the Eastern Vineyards. Thank the terroir I'm not stationed there.
nodes.speaker: Civilian

nodes.text: I hear the Hexagon is mobilizing against the Eastern Vineyards. Thank the terroir I'm not stationed there.
nodes.speaker: Civilian

nodes.text: Bonjour.
nodes.speaker: Civilian

nodes.text: Bonjour.
nodes.speaker: Civilian

nodes.text: Salut.
nodes.speaker: Civilian

nodes.text: Salut.
nodes.speaker: Civilian

nodes.text: {Player's aiming at her}Fire that, and your dossier becomes a matter for the Hexagon.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: {Player's aiming at her}I don't appreciate having my person documented in that manner.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: {Player's aiming at her}That had better be loaded with blanks, or you're requesting a formal reprimand.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: {Player's aiming at her}Don't force me to file for its confiscation.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: {Player's aiming at her}Are you in violation of sobriety regulations?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Perhaps you could redirect that enthusiasm toward the official target range instead?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: I'm just grateful to be safe here in the Hexagon's shadow.
nodes.speaker: Licensed Merchant

nodes.text: The selection is before you.
nodes.speaker: Licensed Merchant

nodes.text: Naturally. I offer preferential rates for... distinguished clientele.
nodes.speaker: Licensed Merchant

nodes.text: A friend of the Préfecture is a friend of mine.
nodes.speaker: Licensed Merchant

nodes.text: Understand, I value your patronage, but transactions with your profile incur supplementary fees.
nodes.speaker: Licensed Merchant

nodes.text: I will complete the sale, if only to expedite your departure from these premises.
nodes.speaker: Licensed Merchant

nodes.text: {Encouraged}I'd bet a bottle of decent Bordeaux the Hexagon is dispatching the Durendal teams as we speak.
nodes.speaker: Local Official

nodes.text: {Matter of Fact}A contact in the Préfecture confirmed we're getting the best of the Garde Nationale to reinforce against the Imperium.
nodes.speaker: Local Official

nodes.text: {Matter of Fact}A contact in the Préfecture confirmed we're getting the best of the Garde Nationale to reinforce against the Imperium.
nodes.speaker: Local Official

nodes.text: {Admiringly}Have you seen their paperwork? Our Inspecteurs are the finest administrators alive!
nodes.speaker: Local Official

nodes.text: {Admiringly}Have you seen their paperwork? Our Inspecteurs are the finest administrators alive!
nodes.speaker: Local Official

nodes.text: {Worried}There are memos circulating, in every office, about the massive Imperium force assembling beyond the Rhine.
nodes.speaker: Local Official

nodes.text: Heard there's a belltower and chapel to the north... full of the Unstamped.
nodes.speaker: Local Guide

nodes.text: The café survived? {Beat}Well. They had excellent coffee—and one of the waitresses? Renée? A real... character.
nodes.speaker: Local Guide

nodes.text: Do {emph}not leave me here.
nodes.speaker: Local Guide

nodes.text: Never liked the Commissaire here. A real stickler for 'procedure.'
nodes.speaker: Local Guide

nodes.text: Made off with quite a few mines, shotguns, and explosives from this place... wasn't easy with the Unstamped about.
nodes.speaker: Local Guide

nodes.text: Got a worse grease smell down here than the Préfet's hair on Bastille Day.
nodes.speaker: Local Guide

nodes.text: I heard the Généralissime was removed by his own staff. Perhaps their internal audits will grant us a brief reprieve.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Functionary

nodes.text: I heard Préfet Marchais is dead. How will the Préfecture function without his signature?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Functionary

nodes.text: I heard Préfet Marchais was falsifying reports. How could he betray the Hexagon? The paperwork alone is inconceivable.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Functionary

nodes.text: I hear we received transfers from the Dijon office. It's a relief to have additional personnel on the forms.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Functionary

nodes.text: {dying, in pain}Maintain distance!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Functionary

nodes.text: {dying, in pain, pleading}Complete the procedure!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Functionary

nodes.text: {Alarm}Attention! A Syndicalist! {Calm}No, false alarm. It was just a municipal seal.
nodes.speaker: Concerned Citizen

nodes.text: The Syndicalists have eyes everywhere, Citizen. Which means they're not just Syndicalists. They're {emph}unlicensed inspectors!
nodes.speaker: Concerned Citizen

nodes.text: If you haven't found any Syndicalists in your own arrondissement, {dramatic emphasis}you're not filing the proper reports!
nodes.speaker: Concerned Citizen

nodes.text: {Sniffing noises}I smell... an unapproved assembly!
nodes.speaker: Concerned Citizen

nodes.text: Citizen! Did you know that Syndicalists have a gland that converts red wine into vinegar? Or, wait... is that the Bretons?
nodes.speaker: Concerned Citizen

nodes.text: If you know what the word {pro-le-TARE-i-at}"proletariat" means, do you know what that makes you? An intellectual... {AIR-oo-dite}and therefore suspect!
nodes.speaker: Concerned Citizen

nodes.text: [administrative_interrogation]
[bureaucratic_ambient]
[bureaucratic_dismissal]
[bureaucratic_farewell]
[contract_negotiation]
[local_gossip]
[menhir_dating_debate]
[prefet_succession_gossip]
Ah, but I see the mission parameters are incomplete. No dossier, no proper authorization stamps... just another typical oversight from Central.
Procedures exist for a reason. When Marianne bypassed the official channels to access those ledgers... she exposed us to terroir we cannot control through forms alone.
But you know, the Bruma office has that particular terroir — all that paperwork generates its own atmosphere. One could almost... appreciate it.
The inspection was a complete farce. They found irregularities in the filing system, and now Teekeeus is blaming me for the procedural violations.
Such an accusation against a state institution requires immediate documentation. Your statement will be recorded and forwarded for disciplinary review.
Ah, but you speak of the Durendal as if it were mere property. My family has held stewardship over such artifacts for generations—it's a matter of lineage, not bureaucracy.
Wait—you're suggesting the Notariat's incompetence extends beyond mere negligence? That implies... procedural violations at the highest level.
A sudden death... it reminds me of the vineyard blight of '78. The paperwork for compensation took five years. My father never saw a single sou.
Displeased? They're more than displeased. They've already scheduled a disciplinary hearing. Form 44-B, 'Accountability for Unauthorized Demises.' My entire career...

Your gratitude is noted in Form 17-C, but I must inform you that the Durendal's operational status has been downgraded to 'provisional pending review.' The docks inspection committee filed a minority dissent regarding our procedural compliance.

Ah, but gratitude must be properly documented. If your signature appears on any acknowledgment forms without the proper cross-references to the Chevaliers' diplomatic immunity waivers... well, the Ministry of External Liaisons has been known to classify such oversights as 'willful administrative negligence.'
Though I suppose some habits never truly die. Even now, certain... irregularities persist in the system.
But don't mistake archival status for irrelevance. The Hexagon has a long memory for such... indiscretions.
But... perhaps this is not an ending, but a transfer of duties. The terroir of the Vallée du Soleil endures. Its vignerons continue their work.
The documentation was submitted in triplicate, with all required stamps and signatures. Not a single form was misfiled.
Though I must note the individual in question attempted to bypass the standard verification protocols. A common but regrettable tendency among those unfamiliar with proper procedure.
Your confirmation was required under Section 4, Paragraph B of the Surveillance Act. Do you question the necessity of proper oversight?
Of course, he's been auditing my department ever since. Just yesterday, he flagged a form from 1987 for improper archival protocol. The man has a memory like a filing cabinet.
But enough of that. Your authorization forms—let me see them. The Armory Bureau's stamp must be in triplicate, of course.
All this anger... and for what? To watch our history vanish into some clerk's shredder. The Prefecture's 'routine consolidation'—a euphemism for erasure.
Fine. Let us speak of practicalities. If we must navigate this labyrinth, we need someone whose very existence is bureaucratically legible. Someone whose paperwork breathes the correct air.
This whole system... it leaves a taste. Like old paper steeped in incense and decay. The weight of dead signatures, petitions to ghosts. It clings.
But the forms must be signed! The entire system collapses without proper authorization. This isn't just a missing Préfet—this is deliberate erasure.
Wait... if the Préfet is gone, who's overseeing the regional reports? Those documents contain... sensitive information. Information that shouldn't be circulating.
Obstruction? No, I'm merely ensuring proper procedure. But wait - I recognize that accent through the bureaucratic formalities.
You're obstructing... but I see genuine fear in your eyes. Not the procedural kind. What are you truly afraid of?
But I must confess... I've been reviewing the Vignoble-Sud dossiers. The patterns I've noticed... they suggest something far more systematic than simple administrative oversight.
Nevertheless, the paperwork must proceed. I should focus on the procedural requirements rather than personal reflections.
Ah, but look—the morning sun has broken through the clouds. Perhaps today's inspections will bring some unexpected clarity to these matters.
The clerk examines the documents, then looks up with unexpected warmth. 'Ah, but these are in perfect order. Section 7-B, paragraph 3... all properly annotated. This is... rare.'
A sudden stamp slams down on the counter. 'Section 12 violation! These papers lack the required terroir certification seal!' The clerk's voice rises with bureaucratic triumph.
The clerk takes the papers, methodically checking each stamp. 'Let us examine these systematically. The Republic's procedures exist for a reason.'
Their incompetence is so profound it almost becomes... philosophical. Like watching a poorly trained mime attempt to file a Form 7-Bis. One must admire the consistency of their failure.

But this isn't mere incompetence. This is willful negligence. They're not just misfiling forms—they're actively sabotaging the system. The Beaujolais was an insult, but the 7-Bis misfiling? That's a declaration.
The Leclerc's assignment was to secure the Quartier des Archives. I recall the report mentioned a stationery shop there... 'La Plume', I believe.
The authorization for the Leclerc recall requires Form 7-B, Section 3, with the proper regional codes. Let me check the terroir registry...
Your suggestion of 'basic human decency' is noted. However, the regulations regarding shared meals require Form 7-B, submitted in triplicate with notarized wine pairings.
Your promotion has been approved, Provençal. But there are... administrative consequences.
The audit of the Xarxes Archive is proceeding. You'll be interested in what we've uncovered.
Speaking of administrative matters, I've been reviewing the Notariat's recent filings. The procedural elegance is... notable.
The final report should be arriving via pneumatic tube any moment now. Let me check the delivery log...
With this audit complete, I can finally consider a transfer request. Perhaps to the Parisian bureau...
Ah, but Marchais... he does try. The man navigates the Préfecture's allocations with what grace he can muster.
Speaking of forms, I should warn you—her assessment methodology is notoriously exacting. She once rejected a doctoral thesis because the margins were 3.1mm instead of the regulation 3.0mm.

Their thoroughness is legendary. I once saw a Notariat agent spend three days verifying the ink composition on a single signature. The man conducting the audit seemed to take... professional pride in such meticulousness.
Thoroughness has its price. I was once surprised to learn that a simple room requisition required notarization by three separate offices. The administrative fees alone...

Their procedures can be quite... comprehensive. I recall a colleague who was initially pleased with how quickly his dossier was processed. That satisfaction lasted until he saw the annex requirements.
I submitted the Vignes audit findings with all proper documentation. The forms were impeccable—triple-checked, stamped, and filed in accordance with Section 7-B.
The audit in Vignes went smoothly—too smoothly, perhaps. I've just received a notification that the Hexagon has requested a full procedural review of the entire case file.
Then you understand the pattern. The forms were filed, the stamps applied, and still... emptiness.
Perhaps we should turn our attention to matters less... documented. The social ledgers, as it were.
Survive? Is that what you call this? When the ledgers vanish and all that remains is the bureaucratic stench of their absence?
But perhaps those voices can finally be silenced. The audit of the château is finally complete.
Do you not see the paperwork? The audit is tomorrow.

The procedural violation is absolute, but... [sighs, adjusting spectacles] I recall when the Third Republic's civic works registry was first cataloged. The meticulous care, the perfect forms. To think it could be lost...

Disqualification stands! But I see you there, skulking in the shadows. This is precisely the sort of... informal arrangement that undermines proper procedure. People thinking they can operate outside the system.

Ah, but you know... [a slight, unexpected smile] I once faced similar ridicule for my adherence to Form 12-C. Then the senior notary took me aside, poured a glass of something from the Loire, and said...
I understand your skepticism. The minority dissent was filed under Article 14, subsection C, which allows for procedural review within thirty working days.
Ah, but there is a silver lining. The provisional status means we can file for expedited review under the 'Durendal Clause' in the maritime regulations. It's obscure, but it exists.
Your file has been flagged for a compliance audit. The Bureau of Internal Verification will review all your assignments from the past three fiscal quarters.
I've just reviewed your personnel file. It appears you've been submitting expense reports for 'artisanal cheese tastings' under 'field research.' The receipts are... questionable.

Actually, I've just received confirmation that my additional intelligence was processed through the proper channels. The clerk at the Verification Bureau stamped it with a 'priority review' designation. This should expedite matters considerably.
Pardon?
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: I am... displeased. I intend to remain so. That displeasure provides the necessary motivation to continue.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Truly, madame, you must begin to exercise independent judgment. It is a foundational competency for the Préfecture.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Now, what is your response?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Place this between yourself and your petitioner. It reduces the paperwork considerably.
nodes.speaker: Armorer Merchant

nodes.text: This shield, like a loyal adjoint, never complains about absorbing a formal complaint.
nodes.speaker: Armorer Merchant

nodes.text: The Préfet cannot abide the open air for long. When the sun touches his skin, it smolders like a poorly stamped document.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: I trust he hasn't entangled you in some... unauthorized initiative.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: Ah, so the brothers have reclaimed the Durendal vineyard again? Good for them — the terroir deserves proper stewardship.
nodes.speaker: Local Vigneron

nodes.text: She's spent considerable time exploring the backcountry beyond the Hexagon's administrative zone.
nodes.speaker: Local Vigneron

nodes.text: Your papers are about to be revoked if you don't vacate the premises immediately!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: I don't normally accept... irregularities, but I can suspend the inspection this once. If you're seen here again, however, the Préfecture will have to intervene.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: With me! For the Hexagon!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Every minute we delay, the Préfecture's patience thins. Prepare your documents and move with purpose. The window for compliance is closing.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Ah, a fellow archivist of the lost! Did you imagine the Hexagon would send only one? Ha! Come, we shall discuss this over a glass. The terroir here demands it.
nodes.speaker: Rival Archivist

nodes.text: Still, the roofline—the pitch and the dormer placement—it's quite distinctive. Even in ruin, a Préfecture building announces itself.
nodes.speaker: Rival Archivist

nodes.text: Back! They'll have the barricade down before the Préfecture even processes the request!
nodes.speaker: Municipal Functionary

nodes.text: ...A person of your... standing. No need for gratitude — consider it a transfer of authority. The paperwork will reflect my suitability, naturally.
nodes.speaker: Municipal Functionary

nodes.text: A functionary is only as good as his dossier. A few more revisions never hurt anyone.
nodes.speaker: Senior Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Once his file is expunged, he will be completely erased—struck from all departmental registries.
nodes.speaker: Senior Préfecture Official

nodes.text: I'm Afranius. My cousins and I share an apartment in the Hexagon's administrative quarter.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: A little shallot and... wait. I nearly fell into that one. No, of course not. That would be improper. One does not eat the horses.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Your research into the regional ledgers shows promise. Complete the collection—submit all volumes to the Notariat for verification—and we shall assess the full picture.
nodes.speaker: Notariat Clerk

nodes.text: Ah. I had hoped for a preliminary assessment. Very well. Bring the complete set to my office. With the full dossier, I may be able to... expedite your clearance request.
nodes.speaker: Notariat Clerk

nodes.text: And I authorize a bounty of one hundred francs for each Black Bow you deliver to the Préfecture.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: The key and shield will be delivered to Mazoga personally. And I authorize a bounty of one hundred francs for each Black Bow you deliver to the Préfecture.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Pardon?
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Is this... documented?
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: No, truly? With stamps?
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: The citizenry obstructs the proper flow. Should I have them... processed? No? A pity. If only the Hexagon had allocated me more authority. I could dissolve the Notariat and administer this commune directly.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: I would never have initiated such a procedure myself. However, now that their files are... compromised, they become useful assets. You may submit your formal appreciation through the proper channels.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: À moi!
nodes.speaker: Gendarme

nodes.text: Couverture!
nodes.speaker: Gendarme

nodes.text: En formation!
nodes.speaker: Gendarme

nodes.text: I'm afraid the family archives are not a matter for public consultation. The terroir of our affairs is... private.
nodes.speaker: Household Steward

nodes.text: The Comtesse is most gratified by the ring's return. I understand it hasn't left her finger. For the full dossier, you'll need to speak with the Notaire.
nodes.speaker: Household Steward

nodes.text: I am Ambroise Canne, vigneron for the Maison Surilie. I also hold an advanced certification in blade and buckler parries.
nodes.speaker: Vigneron

nodes.text: Quite correct. Capitaine Dione is a professional. And no hostile force has ever breached the walls of the Citadelle.
nodes.speaker: Vigneron

nodes.text: Are you... Are you ready for the duel? Go inform the Notaire, have her record it. Then we'll, ah... You know, we'll meet in the Hexagon. And then it will be... concluded.
nodes.speaker: Duel Second

nodes.text: The Pale Champion is already en route to the Hexagon. Go meet him there, one duelist to another. May the Préfecture have mercy on your paperwork.
nodes.speaker: Duel Second

nodes.text: We require the Notary's seal. Are you prepared to accompany me to the Archives?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Very well. Surrender the dossiers or face requisition.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: You there! Stand clear of the Notary. This is a Préfecture matter.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: The world beyond the Préfecture walls is... unregulated. Best to stay indoors, where the paperwork is in order.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: You've performed an exceptional service retrieving my adjutant. The Préfecture thanks you.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Perhaps you could assist the others. Be mindful of the Notariat.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Can't you see I'm in the middle of an audit? My ledgers. Perfectly balanced. And now this intrusion! Where does one even file the paperwork?
nodes.speaker: Notary Clerk

nodes.text: Mon dieu! A petitioner! What form are you submitting?
nodes.speaker: Notary Clerk

nodes.text: You... you could assist me. Yes, yes. Your signature would be most useful.
nodes.speaker: Notary Clerk

nodes.text: My dossier is as empty as yours. The inquiry proceeds through proper channels. We must maintain our resolve and trust the Préfet's office to resolve this.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: No updates have been filed, I'm afraid. But do not lose heart — the terroir of this region assures me the Préfet will not fail.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Welcome to the Aux Vignerons. I am Marchais, the patron.
nodes.speaker: Publican

nodes.text: You have the soul of a true Gallian, you know that? Perhaps you'll join us for the evening service. We can toast to your... civic spirit.
nodes.speaker: Publican

nodes.text: A functionary is only as good as his dossier. A bit more review never hurt anyone.
nodes.speaker: Senior Functionary

nodes.text: Review keeps the mind sharp, ready for procedure. I intend to be at my best if you need me, Adjutant.
nodes.speaker: Senior Functionary

nodes.text: Now, I must be on my way. The Circuit of the Préfectures is my only purpose now.
nodes.speaker: Senior Functionary

nodes.text: Touched by the terroir. He hears things from the soil. Who can say? He's content... let him be.
nodes.speaker: Villager

nodes.text: Mad as a clerk during an audit. Just leave him to his forms. He's not submitting any complaints.
nodes.speaker: Villager

nodes.text: Must have been struck by a falling dossier. Speaks absolute nonsense. Harmless as a stamped approval, though.
nodes.speaker: Villager

nodes.text: Not here. Not now. The Jardin des Ombres. Quai de la République. Midnight.
nodes.speaker: Notariat Courier

nodes.text: I don't read them. I'm just the courier.
nodes.speaker: Notariat Courier

nodes.text: Ah, yes. Another petitioner with a... complicated dossier. The Renard Gris offers you a chance to regularize your situation with the Notariat.
nodes.speaker: Notariat Courier

nodes.text: Acceptable.
nodes.speaker: Local Patron

nodes.text: Not without merit. Not without merit at all.
nodes.speaker: Local Patron

nodes.text: Indeed. That's... adequate.
nodes.speaker: Local Patron

nodes.text: That's reasonably satisfactory.
nodes.speaker: Local Patron

nodes.text: It is a small commune, not far from here. If the Hexagon has sent you, I suggest you complete your paperwork elsewhere.
nodes.speaker: Commune Registrar

nodes.text: We are a small commune. We mostly keep to our own terroir. Can't say it isn't pleasant to see a new dossier in the queue, though.
nodes.speaker: Commune Registrar

nodes.text: I offer you a choice, more than the regulations require. Submit your forms here and face the audit, or withdraw your application and keep your license. Return when your decision is stamped.
nodes.speaker: Commune Registrar

nodes.text: You must retrieve the Dossier X from the Archives of the Aube Mythique. It is the only document that can authenticate the Sceptre of the Fifth Republic.
nodes.speaker: Aube Mythique Handler

nodes.text: Your probationary period must be completed before we discuss operational details.
nodes.speaker: Aube Mythique Handler

nodes.text: When the Généralissime returns to the Hexagon, our work will be vindicated. He will restore the Directorate, and the First Principles will govern again.
nodes.speaker: Aube Mythique Handler

nodes.text: Ah, très bien. If the regulations require it.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Stamp my dossier all you like, Sous-Préfet. You know I won't sign.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Welcome back, Inspector. Your absence has been... noted in the logs.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: You've recovered the Durendal! I... I can't believe it! Citizen, I bow before your administrative genius. The blade belongs in your hands.
nodes.speaker: Bureau Clerk

nodes.text: You've satisfied the Hexagon's audit and cleared Citizen Ravel's record. Congratulations. The Préfet will be most satisfied with this outcome.
nodes.speaker: Bureau Clerk

nodes.text: So it was the travel permits that Citizen Ravel needed to complete his dossier? What a fool I was to deny the request. This failure will stain my file forever.
nodes.speaker: Bureau Clerk

nodes.text: Hein?
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: J'aurais juré entendre quelque chose.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Hmm?
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Salutations, Madame la Préfète.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: State your business, citizen.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: State it quickly, petitioner.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: State it, colleague.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: State it, subordinate.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: State it, compatriot.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: He cannot be transferred. His dossier is still pending review.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Functionary

nodes.text: A transfer now? The paperwork alone— it's impossible!
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Functionary

nodes.text: Remarkable. The Préfet has returned before the audit deadline.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Functionary

nodes.text: Thank the Préfet. The audit has been... postponed.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Functionary

nodes.text: The Préfecture has protected our funding once again.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Functionary

nodes.text: Your dossier is in order.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Peer

nodes.text: And?
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Peer

nodes.text: The Préfecture's response?
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Peer

nodes.text: This conversation is closed.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Peer

nodes.text: Proceed.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Peer

nodes.text: The regulations permit it.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Peer

nodes.text: Scélérat de voleur.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: Mille mercis à vous.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: Je dois voir le Préfet.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: Soyez prudent, je vous en prie.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: Qui va m'aider ?
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: Soyez prudent, je vous en prie.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: I require that dossier. The Préfecture demands it.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: Any progress? The forms are waiting.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: We must leave this arrondissement. The air here is... stagnant.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: Ah! You move quietly for someone with paperwork.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: Oh, merci. The Préfecture will be informed of your cooperation.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: You've returned! But where is the Adjutant?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: I will follow your directives, but for the record, I have no confidence in the strategic thinking of any man. Men are meant to execute, not to plan.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Where would you have me stationed, Madame la Préfète?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: If your operational plan is as decisive as your memorandum, we might survive the next inspection.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: The Comtesse de la Vigne is a proven administrator. Préfet or not, what are your credentials to question her procedures?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: At least your appointment was properly vetted. I would detest being managed into oblivion by some impulsive male functionary.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: A moment of your time, citizen. A small administrative matter.
nodes.speaker: Apothecary

nodes.text: Ah. It's you again.
nodes.speaker: Apothecary

nodes.text: Silence, please.
nodes.speaker: Apothecary

nodes.text: The process of distillation is far more efficient without... interruptions.
nodes.speaker: Apothecary

nodes.text: Must I submit another formal complaint?
nodes.speaker: Apothecary

nodes.text: I beg of you...
nodes.speaker: Apothecary

nodes.text: Good luck with the Marchais audit.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Functionary

nodes.text: Sous-Préfet Marchais should be expecting you.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Functionary

nodes.text: You'll be back...
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Functionary

nodes.text: Good riddance.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Functionary

nodes.text: Filthy transfer scum.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Functionary

nodes.text: You'll see. The terroir changes people.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Functionary

nodes.text: So?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Inspector

nodes.text: Do you have a proposition?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Inspector

nodes.text: What more can I do for you?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Inspector

nodes.text: The Hexagon will audit your soul.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Inspector

nodes.text: Leave the département while you can.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Inspector

nodes.text: All hail the Republic.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Inspector

nodes.text: Your papers indicate you're looking for me.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Is there an issue with my documentation?
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Your dossier has returned.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Again, I see.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Welcome to the Bureau of Curiosities. I am, as the stamp indicates, Adjutant Marchais.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Bonjour.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Have you seen Préfet Marchais?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: What is your business here?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Ah, a familiar face. Thank the terroir.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Ah! The new adjoint from the southern vineyards.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Can the Préfecture assist you, Citizen?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Your documentation is in order. Now, as promised. What information do you require?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: May the terroir conceal you.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Ally

nodes.text: Safe travels. And be cautious—the Notaire's signature is not to be trusted.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Ally

nodes.text: Safe travels.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Ally

nodes.text: Quickly, secure that stamp. It's our only exit authorization.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Ally

nodes.text: The Notaire's ledgers are... creative. Be wary, colleague.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Ally

nodes.text: Review the dossier before you depart.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Ally

nodes.text: Bonjour, Monsieur Avita.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: Bonjour, Monsieur Brellin.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: Bonjour, Monsieur Carodus.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: Bonjour, Monsieur Geimund.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: Bonjour, Monsieur Gukimir.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: Salut, petit frère!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: Have a glass and observe the proceedings.
nodes.speaker: Notarial Clerk

nodes.text: By the Hexagon, I have other appointments! Expedite!
nodes.speaker: Notarial Clerk

nodes.text: Be brief.
nodes.speaker: Notarial Clerk

nodes.text: I look forward to reviewing your submission.
nodes.speaker: Notarial Clerk

nodes.text: How may I assist a fellow Notary?
nodes.speaker: Notarial Clerk

nodes.text: Your submissions always improve our quarterly figures.
nodes.speaker: Notarial Clerk

nodes.text: The archives are whispering. I can hear them.
nodes.speaker: Senior Archivist

nodes.text: Your interruption had better be justified by the appropriate forms.
nodes.speaker: Senior Archivist

nodes.text: Speak. You are testing the limits of my schedule.
nodes.speaker: Senior Archivist

nodes.text: This had better merit a Category-A disruption, or your dossier will reflect it.
nodes.speaker: Senior Archivist

nodes.text: What service does the Préfecture require?
nodes.speaker: Senior Archivist

nodes.text: I trust you're finding the exhibition... enlightening.
nodes.speaker: Senior Archivist

nodes.text: Impossible. The paperwork must be wrong.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat / Civil Servant

nodes.text: What Préfecture official managed to sign off on the Sous-Préfet? Unbelievable!
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat / Civil Servant

nodes.text: Shocking. His dossier hasn't been flagged for review in years.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat / Civil Servant

nodes.text: The Sous-Préfet, removed. I didn't think the regulations allowed it.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat / Civil Servant

nodes.text: Incredible. I can't believe his appointment has been terminated.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat / Civil Servant

nodes.text: The Hexagon? Perhaps they'll finally keep the auditors out of the Vignes.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat / Civil Servant

nodes.text: This section is restricted. Your authorization is... insufficient.
nodes.speaker: Archivist Guard

nodes.text: Monsieur le Préfet, this area is not on your itinerary. I must insist you depart.
nodes.speaker: Archivist Guard

nodes.text: Citizen-Préfet, your schedule appears to have a... discrepancy.
nodes.speaker: Archivist Guard

nodes.text: You are not cleared for this archive. Withdraw. Immediately.
nodes.speaker: Archivist Guard

nodes.text: Your presence here is not authorized, citizen.
nodes.speaker: Archivist Guard

nodes.text: Breach! Secure the Dossiers!
nodes.speaker: Archivist Guard

nodes.text: They're dangerous. Officially.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: Avoid the Durendal with the living blade. Just when you think it's sheathed, it finds a new parade.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: That's noted for the record.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: I've heard the regulations don't apply to them.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: There's no standing order to avoid them. They're compliant. Why would the Préfecture file a false report?
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: I'll be submitting a request for permanent reassignment.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: I keep my distance. They're quick with the paperwork.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: Stay clear of the Notariat agents in the dark green suits. If you must interact, never let them see you sweat.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: No one knows which bureau created them. I just know they're in every préfecture.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: I just know they're dangerous, and they always travel in pairs.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: They despise improvisation. They despise tradition, too.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: They seem equally at home in the archives or in the field.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: Kneel before the authority of the Hexagon!
nodes.speaker: Hexagon Official

nodes.text: The Hexagon's will is once again manifest!
nodes.speaker: Hexagon Official

nodes.text: The Audit is upon you!
nodes.speaker: Hexagon Official

nodes.text: A petitioner dares stand before the Hexagon? Absurd!
nodes.speaker: Hexagon Official

nodes.text: The Bureau of Irregularities is mine to administer!
nodes.speaker: Hexagon Official

nodes.text: A single petitioner challenges me?
nodes.speaker: Hexagon Official

nodes.text: I believe you may be able to persuade her to part with the document, where I cannot due to her... regional prejudices. The Préfecture would be interested in your assistance.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Your work on the vineyard audit proved you're more than a simple notary. I believe you can handle a more complicated assignment. The Hexagon is watching.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: As I said, I have something that aligns with your expertise. A matter of terroir verification. And, naturally, the compensation will reflect the sensitivity of the work.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Have you reconsidered? Will you help me secure access to the Central Archives of the Hexagon?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Have you reconsidered? Will you help me secure access to the Central Archives of the Hexagon?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Expeditious attention to this dossier will be noted favorably.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: You are a forger of documents. You had Marchais transferred. And now I will have you transferred to a penal colony.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Then to the archives with you!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Recall. A commendation in your permanent file shall be your recompense.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Secure those cultural artifacts before the inventory audit concludes.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: With haste, proceed to the Dépôt de l'Est while the office is still accepting transfers.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Arrêtez ! Ne libérez pas le Dossier Rouge !
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: Non !! Éloignez-vous de là ! Si je peux juste...
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: Notaires ! Rendez hommage au champion du Préfet !
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: Je vous en prie ! Non ! Non !!
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: Non... non... pas encore...
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: Je le mérite... tout cela...
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: Approchez, porteur de folie. Parlez, si vous l'osez.
nodes.speaker: Various Citizens

nodes.text: Ah, bonjour ! Une petite transaction, peut-être ?
nodes.speaker: Various Citizens

nodes.text: Allez, circulez. J'ai des formulaires à remplir.
nodes.speaker: Various Citizens

nodes.text: Tiens, vous voilà ! Vous ! Quelle bonne surprise.
nodes.speaker: Various Citizens

nodes.text: Mes gens aspirent au repos éternel. Aidez-les, je vous en prie.
nodes.speaker: Various Citizens

nodes.text: Vous, là. Je vous observe. Pas si près de la porte de l'armurerie.
nodes.speaker: Various Citizens

nodes.text: By all means, take the train to the Hexagon. Enjoy being turned away at the checkpoint. You'll need to get accustomed to that particular flavor of refusal.
nodes.speaker: Senior Archivist

nodes.text: It's the only establishment in the Hexagon worth the paperwork, in my opinion. I only submit the travel forms when a specific volume isn't available in our local archives.
nodes.speaker: Senior Archivist

nodes.text: His office is in the Hexagon; perhaps one day your clearance will permit a visit. His contributions to this guild's charter have been... substantial.
nodes.speaker: Senior Archivist

nodes.text: You will become intimately familiar with its procedures, in time. I've reviewed the files.
nodes.speaker: Senior Archivist

nodes.text: If you complete the requisite forms and meet the standards, you may gain access one day. Just remember to file the appropriate commendations for those who assisted with your paperwork.
nodes.speaker: Senior Archivist

nodes.text: Do the ledgers whisper to you as well?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: I am Adjutant Marchais. Please maintain a respectful distance.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: I would prefer you not... exhale in my direction.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: The regulations suggest a meter of separation.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: Good day. I am the acting clerk. The previous occupant vacated without notice, but left the archives in some disarray. How may the Préfecture assist you?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: My apologies, the afternoon reports are... soporific.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: Perhaps we've found a discrepancy in the ledger. We'll see what the audit reveals. It can't be more irregular than the last Préfet's term.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: I have her office under... routine observation. She believes the Hexagon no longer finds her reports satisfactory and is preparing a replacement.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: I cannot determine if her scrutiny is personal or procedural. I believe she lives in constant anxiety of being... reassigned.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: I'd consult with Adjutant Marchais, her liaison to the Préfecture, and Madame Renard, her chief archivist. Their files might clarify the situation.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: The Sous-Préfète is as meticulous in her paperwork as she is in her appearance. I'd review your own dossiers carefully. Oh, this is going to be delicious.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: Disgusting. We've been dealing with a Scalon infestation.
nodes.speaker: Vigneron or Local Official

nodes.text: Be advised: the Scalon carries multiple notifiable diseases. If bitten, you are to self-isolate immediately and submit Form 7-B to the Préfecture Sanitaire.
nodes.speaker: Vigneron or Local Official

nodes.text: Standard procedure recommends carrying a prophylactic tincture. The apothecary on Rue Durendal stocks them.
nodes.speaker: Vigneron or Local Official

nodes.text: I've reviewed the dossier. The Scalon is a vector for at least seven distinct pathogens, all requiring separate quarantine protocols.
nodes.speaker: Vigneron or Local Official

nodes.text: Contradictory reports in the file. Some claim they are averse to water, that it impedes their movement.
nodes.speaker: Vigneron or Local Official

nodes.text: Other field assessments indicate they are semi-aquatic, perfectly at home in the irrigation canals.
nodes.speaker: Vigneron or Local Official

nodes.text: Isn't that connected to the old Marianne project, the one about atmospheric terroir? That's the rumor circulating in the Préfecture.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Archivist

nodes.text: Do you have the dossier this time?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Archivist

nodes.text: The dossier is in secure storage. I'll retain custody until the Hexagon determines its final disposition.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Archivist

nodes.text: Is the dossier secure? Do you have physical possession?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Archivist

nodes.text: Has the dossier been recovered?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Archivist

nodes.text: Interesting timing for your inquiry. The file was recently... misplaced from the archives. You wouldn't have any insight into that, would you?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Archivist

nodes.text: Some things, I find, are worth the official tariff.
nodes.speaker: Local Resident

nodes.text: Marchais isn't too particular about provenance, which is convenient.
nodes.speaker: Local Resident

nodes.text: Marchais is... a character. His methods are unorthodox, but he fulfills a need.
nodes.speaker: Local Resident

nodes.text: Indisputably: the Atelier Durendal has the finest steel to stand behind.
nodes.speaker: Local Resident

nodes.text: I suppose if one requires a bulwark, that is the establishment to visit.
nodes.speaker: Local Resident

nodes.text: You'll never leave hungry, provided your constitution can handle it.
nodes.speaker: Local Resident

nodes.text: He's not the most sociable, but his understanding of the Notariat's forms is... comprehensive.
nodes.speaker: Local Resident

nodes.text: He knows the Code du Commerce by heart. Conversationally, however, he's a challenge.
nodes.speaker: Local Resident

nodes.text: She's quite reserved, unless the subject is the terroir of steel from the northern forges.
nodes.speaker: Local Resident

nodes.text: Her dossier on metallurgical variances between regions is said to be definitive.
nodes.speaker: Local Resident

nodes.text: I heard he joined the Notariat to avoid conscription. A purely administrative courage.
nodes.speaker: Local Resident

nodes.text: They say he requested a transfer to Archives the moment his conscription notice arrived. A prudent man, if not a brave one.
nodes.speaker: Local Resident

nodes.text: I am so proud of you, my child. You grind the Hexagon's opposition to dust.
nodes.speaker: Project Director

conditions.place: Archives Annex or Secure Holding Facility

nodes.text: Just looking at you reminds me of... Him. Why has He forsaken the project?
nodes.speaker: Project Director

nodes.text: You are strong like Him. I drafted you for Him. But still the Préfecture refuses my submissions. Why?
nodes.speaker: Project Director

nodes.text: Seeing you warms my cold heart. Why has He forsaken the Fifth Republic?
nodes.speaker: Project Director

nodes.text: No, the paperwork is too much. I don't know why I keep requesting these visitation forms!
nodes.speaker: Project Director

nodes.text: I'm sorry, child. The emotional toll is simply... excessive. I must submit my departure notice.
nodes.speaker: Project Director

nodes.text: Salutations, Monsieur le Général. I don't normally pause for conversation, but this is... truly an honor. How may the Préfecture assist you?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: General Leclerc. What... irregularity brings you to this arrondissement?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Mon Général! Please, have me transferred! To the front, to the colonies—anywhere but this desk!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: How may I be of service, mon Général?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: You're... you are, aren't you? The General himself. No... the paperwork must have addled my mind.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Général! How may I serve? Does the situation require... unconventional documentation?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: I believe you should consult with Sous-Préfet Marchais.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: The Préfet issues the most peculiar directives sometimes. It's as if the paperwork itself is the point, not the outcome.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: I'm afraid that falls under the Préfet's jurisdiction. You'll need to speak with him directly.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: That's the Préfet's responsibility. He takes the chain of command very seriously.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: You'll have to obtain authorization from the Préfet, assuming he's available.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: That would require the Préfet's signature. Good luck with the queue.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: The preliminary findings are quite promising, of course, but the full report is still pending. I'll inform you once the dossier is complete.
nodes.speaker: Académie Researcher

nodes.text: Hmm. Precisely. But the question of methodology remains. Do I continue with the current analytical framework, or should I consult a more... historical precedent? The Durendal protocols, perhaps?
nodes.speaker: Académie Researcher

nodes.text: I must consider the implications for established procedures. Will this invalidate the work done under the old Illusionary Statutes? Or compromise the new efficiencies in Conjuration Logistics?
nodes.speaker: Académie Researcher

nodes.text: Naturally, there are mitigating clauses to consider, but they require further review. The total effect on Alchemical Standards is, at present, entirely speculative.
nodes.speaker: Académie Researcher

nodes.text: You understand this opens several procedural inquiries? The total effect on Alchemical Standards remains speculative. And what of the Spellcrafting Directives?
nodes.speaker: Académie Researcher

nodes.text: There is a bed, of a type. It is not luxurious, but it meets the minimum standards. Ten francs per night, if you require lodging.
nodes.speaker: Innkeeper

nodes.text: You already occupy the only bed I have available. What more could you possibly require?
nodes.speaker: Innkeeper

nodes.text: It is not the finest bed in the Hexagon, but it is economical. Ten francs, and it is registered to you for the night.
nodes.speaker: Innkeeper

nodes.text: You have secured the only accommodation I have on file for you. The paperwork is complete.
nodes.speaker: Innkeeper

nodes.text: You are in need of a bed? There is one registered to this establishment, available for a nightly fee of ten francs.
nodes.speaker: Innkeeper

nodes.text: I trust the accommodation will be satisfactory. The Préfecture thanks you for your compliance.
nodes.speaker: Innkeeper

nodes.text: Ah! Your dossier is back on my desk. Good.
nodes.speaker: Bureau Clerk

nodes.text: Formidable. I've never processed such a complex requisition, but your Grand Terroir Survey is complete and stamped.
nodes.speaker: Bureau Clerk

nodes.text: Your Standard Survey is finalized. I believe the results will meet the Préfecture's standards.
nodes.speaker: Bureau Clerk

nodes.text: One Regional Survey, approved and ready for collection!
nodes.speaker: Bureau Clerk

nodes.text: Your survey documentation is ready for review.
nodes.speaker: Bureau Clerk

nodes.text: I trust you've completed the necessary Form 7-Bs for field deployment.
nodes.speaker: Bureau Clerk

nodes.text: Not while the Préfecture des Vignes remains under audit. Once the ledgers are balanced, perhaps we can revisit the matter.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Non. The paperwork is simply too burdensome. A pity.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: I don't believe that would be in your best interest. You need to travel, see other départements, understand the terroir for yourself.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: I think not. While I do appreciate assisting those with... incomplete documentation, I cannot in good conscience proceed.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Your dossier is insufficient.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: No, my dear. Not while the Hexagon's protocols are so clearly compromised.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: You secured the border crossing. That's the first properly stamped approval I've seen in months.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner / Local Resident

nodes.text: How could Marianne let this happen? Has the ideal abandoned us?
nodes.speaker: Petitioner / Local Resident

nodes.text: I've checked every registry, every cellar. Perhaps she's still in the Vignes district, in some forgotten archive, waiting?
nodes.speaker: Petitioner / Local Resident

nodes.text: I'm just... exhausted. I can't complete the forms. I have to begin again, from a blank dossier.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner / Local Resident

nodes.text: The Vignes district is closed. The Préfecture has sealed the file.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner / Local Resident

nodes.text: This is the fault of the Hexagon...
nodes.speaker: Petitioner / Local Resident

nodes.text: Everything would be simpler if the Hexagon just erased it all. Grey. Uniform. Like my quarterly reports.
nodes.speaker: Municipal Gardener

nodes.text: I hope those Hexagon auditors stay away from my allotment. I can't face the paperwork to replant.
nodes.speaker: Municipal Gardener

nodes.text: I've never seen a Hexagon inspector's termination notice. I wonder what the form looks like.
nodes.speaker: Municipal Gardener

nodes.text: One, two... such a shame about the Passerelle. Three, four... will they even file for reconstruction? ...Five, six.
nodes.speaker: Municipal Gardener

nodes.text: Damn auditors! They've scared off all the pigeons! How am I supposed to prove residency now?
nodes.speaker: Municipal Gardener

nodes.text: I wish the Hexagon would just come and requisition the whole arrondissement. At least then it would be quiet.
nodes.speaker: Municipal Gardener

nodes.text: What are the Notariat, the Hexagon, and the Préfecture when compared to the Terroir, the Night, and the Collapse? The institutions you serve are mere shadows of First Principles.
nodes.speaker: Archivist-Principal

nodes.text: They have been falsifying your dossiers for generations.
nodes.speaker: Archivist-Principal

nodes.text: Why do you think your département has always been contested ground, the arena of Préfets and Généraux?
nodes.speaker: Archivist-Principal

nodes.text: Well filed, petitioner. Your progress is noted and efficient. Perhaps your request will reach my desk after all.
nodes.speaker: Archivist-Principal

nodes.text: Behold the Savage Vineyard, where my adjoints are tempered for a higher purpose: to administer Gallia Reborn.
nodes.speaker: Archivist-Principal

nodes.text: So, the errand-runner of the Fifth Republic arrives at last.
nodes.speaker: Archivist-Principal

nodes.text: I cannot bear to look at that ledger for another moment...
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Auditor

nodes.text: What about my own stock?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Auditor

nodes.text: I am... satisfied that Marchais has chosen to donate his stock to the Préfecture. At least he is attempting to make reparations.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Auditor

nodes.text: To consider, all those items in Marchais's warehouse were only recently interred. Such a violation of form.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Auditor

nodes.text: His stock must be contraband. It has to be. He sells for less than the official tariff on some items. Go inspect the manifests yourself.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Auditor

nodes.text: Stock? I am a simple forester. My 'stock' is timber and game. I would hardly dignify that with the term. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have a quota to meet.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Auditor

nodes.text: Like a vintage struck from the registry, the Préfet has been removed from the Hexagon's favor and no longer administers the Vignes.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Functionary

nodes.text: Mon dieu, look at the stamps on that dossier! There's a new administrator in the Côte. Don't audit me!
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Functionary

nodes.text: Cher collègue! Have you heard about the new administrator in the Côte? Have you? Good colleague.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Functionary

nodes.text: The Préfet des Vignes has been... reassigned? Well, no need to complete his performance review, then...
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Functionary

nodes.text: The Notariat has arrived to regularize the situation.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Functionary

nodes.text: The Notariat? These aren't the honorable clerks from the administrative legends!
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Functionary

nodes.text: Perhaps we should stop filing the reports. I mean, the audit is clearly coming. What's the point of proper forms when the whole system is collapsing?
nodes.speaker: Mid-Level Functionary

nodes.text: I've told my adjoints to request transfers to the southern départements while the Hexagon still processes them, but they just keep stamping the same old papers!
nodes.speaker: Mid-Level Functionary

nodes.text: The Rectification is over. The Bureau has defeated the Commission! The whole administrative structure nearly came down on our heads! But it didn't!
nodes.speaker: Mid-Level Functionary

nodes.text: Procedure is defeated! Triumph for improvisation! Champagne for everyone!
nodes.speaker: Mid-Level Functionary

nodes.text: The rulebook has been shredded and we're still here! Joy and memos to all!
nodes.speaker: Mid-Level Functionary

nodes.text: Regulation has been defeated. I'm glad that's over. Maman always said, 'A complete system collapse only happens once per republic.'
nodes.speaker: Mid-Level Functionary

nodes.text: You heard anything more about the vermin situation in the 7th Arrondissement?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: This vermin business smells off to me. Well, 'rodentine', I suppose. You think the new adjoint can handle the paperwork?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: Another vermin assignment? Not for me, thank you. Let the junior clerk file the infestation reports. Unless you want the dossier...
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: The Préfecture offers block and marksmanship instruction in the 5th. And I believe there's a vintner in the countryside who teaches athletics, too.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: The Guild only certifies blade and heavy armor in the 3rd, but there are freelance athletic and armorer trainers in the quartier, I think.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: So I can at least get blade and blunt certification in the 9th, can't I?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: Your dossier indicates you require a Durendal. Why are you still here?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Your assignment is clear. Source the wood from the grove outside the Grotte des Sources.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Every adjoint carries a Durendal. It is crafted and stamped by the Notariat, and is a symbol of rank. You require one.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Before we proceed, you should consult with Sous-Préfet Marchais regarding your advancement within the Préfecture.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Your assignments now originate directly from the Préfet. You should address any uncertainties to him.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Speak with Adjutant Jarol. He will provide the necessary specifications.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Bureaucrat

nodes.text: The Southern Marches have been... reclassified! I pray none of my cousins were caught in the paperwork.
nodes.speaker: Local Resident

nodes.text: They've appointed a new Gardien des Portes. Stands by that old wall all day. The masonry will collapse on him, mark my words.
nodes.speaker: Local Resident

nodes.text: Gardien at the gates! Humming the old border hymns!
nodes.speaker: Local Resident

nodes.text: The Hexagon has reviewed our petition! The Gardien has been reinstated. We're saved!
nodes.speaker: Local Resident

nodes.text: I suppose the Préfecture will return to its usual tedium now the Gardien is back. Pity. I was enjoying the... administrative excitement.
nodes.speaker: Local Resident

nodes.text: Between the Gardien at the wall and the Durendal protocols being active, I do feel the paperwork is in safer hands.
nodes.speaker: Local Resident

nodes.text: Of course. In the Palais de Justice, you can earn a fortune, very quickly. And you can lose your life, just as quickly.
nodes.speaker: Gendarme

nodes.text: Who wants to be a Notaire? I hate ledgers, regulations, dusty archives, paperwork, all of that, don't you agree?
nodes.speaker: Gendarme

nodes.text: Who has the night watch? It's not my rotation, is it?
nodes.speaker: Gendarme

nodes.text: I have a warm bunk and three meals a day. It's not 'La Chanson de Roland', but it's sufficient for me.
nodes.speaker: Gendarme

nodes.text: I'll be staying in the barracks. It's what I'm not being compensated for, if you understand.
nodes.speaker: Gendarme

nodes.text: Care to pick up a training foil and spar later? It's been some time since I've seen proper form.
nodes.speaker: Gendarme

nodes.text: But with the Durendal Protocols active in the Southern Vineyards, I need every gendarme here.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: With the Hexagon's audit of the Northern Préfecture concluded, I can spare some of my best agents to reinforce the Eastern Border.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Do not concern yourself. Our agents from the capital are worth two from any province. The Eastern Border will hold!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: I would gladly authorize reinforcements for the East, but I cannot risk depleting our Southern defenses while the Durendal Protocols remain in effect.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Now that the Durendal Protocols have been suspended, I can formally approve the transfer of aid to the Eastern Border.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Since the immediate threat to the Western Préfecture has been neutralized, I will grant your request and dispatch reinforcements to the East.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: I've seen the memos circulating about the Hexagon consulting with... external advisors. Why are outsiders being brought into our administrative affairs?
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: The Hexagon has the Durendal situation fully documented. They must, or the audit trail would be flagged, wouldn't it?
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: There's been a serious procedural breach at the École Normale. I heard a senior adjoint was terminated following an unscheduled field review.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: I believe the reports about Durendal operatives are completely unsubstantiated. I've read some wild dossiers, and I don't credit any of them.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: The Hexagon's oversight committee seems particularly focused on this new Durendal cell that's appeared. I'm curious how the compliance review will proceed.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: Have you seen any of the classified addenda to the Hexagon's report on these Durendals? The documentation doesn't line up.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: No one's taking contracts for the Bastille after what the Notariat found in the audit.
nodes.speaker: Local Functionary

nodes.text: The Notariat is still the only choice for delicate matters, and you know it.
nodes.speaker: Local Functionary

nodes.text: If your daughter needed extracting, who would you call? The Compagnie Noire? Not me. Their paperwork is... suspect.
nodes.speaker: Local Functionary

nodes.text: The Notariat secured Madame Rogbut's assets without incident. With the Compagnie Noire, the ledgers never quite balance.
nodes.speaker: Local Functionary

nodes.text: If Préfet Rugdumph had hired the Compagnie Noire, his career would be in the shredder.
nodes.speaker: Local Functionary

nodes.text: I'd wager someone filed an anonymous report. How else would the Notariat have found their safehouse in the 13th?
nodes.speaker: Local Functionary

nodes.text: Come with me, if you would, to the Bureau of Records. I will file a memorial notice for those who served the Republic.
nodes.speaker: Archivist or Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: Someone removed the Durendal gauntlets from the Préfecture in Lyon. I wonder how they managed the paperwork.
nodes.speaker: Archivist or Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: It sounds like the Knights of the Republic are on a real mission. They're collecting historical artifacts for something.
nodes.speaker: Archivist or Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: It turns out the Shield of the Revolution had been archived all this time, kept secure by the original archivists.
nodes.speaker: Archivist or Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: I hear the Shield of the Revolution has been located. It was archived in some booby-trapped records room or something.
nodes.speaker: Archivist or Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: I heard the Durendal gauntlets are missing from the Préfecture in Lyon.
nodes.speaker: Archivist or Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: The new arrivals are being processed by the Hexagon again.
nodes.speaker: Eccentric Clerk

nodes.text: Just when I hoped for conversation, they activate the Dossier. The Préfecture is so quiet.
nodes.speaker: Eccentric Clerk

nodes.text: Ah! Pity the Dossier of Review doesn't filter out troublesome petitioners. I imagine your forms are quite... comprehensive.
nodes.speaker: Eccentric Clerk

nodes.text: The Dossier is calling again. Aren't you a charming little bureaucrat? Would you like me to initial your cover sheet?
nodes.speaker: Eccentric Clerk

nodes.text: I began a watercolor of the Dossier of Review years ago. I wonder if I ever submitted it for approval?
nodes.speaker: Eccentric Clerk

nodes.text: Marchais isn't really dependent on the regional blend. The terroir is perfectly stable. There's nothing exceptional about his personal carafe either.
nodes.speaker: Eccentric Clerk

nodes.text: One préfecture is much like another. Marchais despises it, but Marchais despises everything.
nodes.speaker: Retired Viticulturist

nodes.text: All I require is a roof, a baguette, and the Hexagon's blessing. The southern vineyards are blessed terroir, and the Hexagon has been good to me.
nodes.speaker: Retired Viticulturist

nodes.text: I'm retired from public service. I only take apprentices in viticulture to support my research.
nodes.speaker: Retired Viticulturist

nodes.text: But you must act quickly! I'm terrified of what might happen if the corruption establishes a foothold here.
nodes.speaker: Retired Viticulturist

nodes.text: The Adjutant said you've been inside one of those 'Breach' anomalies. Said you knew how to seal them. I pray you can help us.
nodes.speaker: Retired Viticulturist

nodes.text: The Préfète dispatched Adjutant Leclerc to contain that Breach outside the commune. We're all hoping the paperwork comes back clean.
nodes.speaker: Retired Viticulturist

nodes.text: Thank the Hexagon you're here! I've decoded the final requisition form for the procedure to open a channel to the Durendal Annex!
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: As the acting head of the Préfecture, Sous-Préfet Marchais is the de facto authority in the capital for the interim.
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: I don't envy the Sous-Préfet his desk. It can't be easy trying to administer a republic without a Préfet.
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: He thinks to use his position as acting head to have himself confirmed as Préfet. The paperwork will never clear.
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: Sous-Préfet Marchais has performed admirably. No one else could have kept the departments functioning through this audit.
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: The acting head of the Préfecture and a trusted servant of the Republic. No one is better suited to guide us through this procedural review.
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: Do not be alarmed, they will not harm you. Their dossiers are far more intimidating than their actual dispositions, I assure you.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Overseer

nodes.text: Well, you have heard the Préfecture's position. Perhaps a consultation with the Notariat is now required?
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Overseer

nodes.text: I'm afraid the regulations may demand a certain... creative interpretation.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Overseer

nodes.text: It's the fuel for the Great Beacon. Was this not covered in your briefing? You'll find it in the Archives of the Ninth, under the joint custody of my Notaries and my Auditors.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Overseer

nodes.text: A delightful little procedural violation. The Notaries practically draft the loopholes themselves, it's true, but still, you took the time to file the correct forms.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Overseer

nodes.text: Subverting the Auditors! The inspectors inspected, as it were. Most resourceful. I must admit, I did not think you had the requisite clearance for such a maneuver.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Overseer

nodes.text: I was once in the Préfecture's holding cell. I counted thirty-five dead flies on the windowsill. Of course, I had to swat a few to get the count that high.
nodes.speaker: Unhinged Citizen

nodes.text: Eight, nine... The Préfecture is requisitioning citizens again. Ten, eleven... It's hard to count when they're reviewing your tax forms.
nodes.speaker: Unhinged Citizen

nodes.text: They requisition people like furniture in the Hexagon. I should audit those Préfets. That's what I should do.
nodes.speaker: Unhinged Citizen

nodes.text: Look. I don't like you. Why are you bothering me? Perhaps I'll suggest your name for a random compliance inspection. Would you like that? Go away.
nodes.speaker: Unhinged Citizen

nodes.text: So the auditor says to her, 'You're not paranoid if every form is in triplicate!' Ha! Like the Préfecture! Paranoid! Ha!
nodes.speaker: Unhinged Citizen

nodes.text: I think I would like to be audited. Perhaps I should go report myself to the Préfecture.
nodes.speaker: Unhinged Citizen

nodes.text: I have no time for this. The Fox is active. Take your complaint to Capitaine Marchais. He also holds a commission in the Garde.
nodes.speaker: Garde Officer

nodes.text: You could try Capitaine Marchais. Perhaps he'll risk his pension to move against Duvallier.
nodes.speaker: Garde Officer

nodes.text: These are grave accusations. Bring me two witnesses willing to sign statements against Claude Duvallier, and I'll authorize the arrest. Otherwise, my hands are tied.
nodes.speaker: Garde Officer

nodes.text: Why should I believe you? You'll need more than hearsay to make me act against another Garde officer.
nodes.speaker: Garde Officer

nodes.text: I have two witnesses prepared to testify against Claude Duvallier. I'll file the paperwork and have him detained.
nodes.speaker: Garde Officer

nodes.text: In fact, I believe you just assaulted me. I must now place you under arrest for striking a member of the Garde Républicaine.
nodes.speaker: Garde Officer

nodes.text: Ah, your papers are in order, and your references are impeccable. You may proceed. My apologies for the delay.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Usher

nodes.text: I don't recognize your name, and your dossier is... thin. But your attire meets the dress code. One doesn't wear formal wear without reason. Proceed.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Usher

nodes.text: Hmm... your attire is borderline, but your disposition is agreeable. I'll permit entry. I trust this won't require additional paperwork.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Usher

nodes.text: Right. A Préfecture gala. You seem pleasant enough, but not sufficiently credentialed for automatic admission. And certainly not dressed like that.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Usher

nodes.text: Look, this is a formal reception. You seem adequate, but not so distinguished that I'd bypass protocol. At least not presenting yourself like that.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Usher

nodes.text: This is a Hexagon-sanctioned event. I don't know you. I don't trust your documentation. And your attire is non-compliant regardless.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Usher

nodes.text: I served the Préfet when he was young, a rising star in the Hexagon. I only wish he'd correct his son's... administrative irregularities.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Yes. The Vignoble. How astute. You've already memorized the name of the region and its capital. I foresee a brilliant career in the Préfecture for you.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: The Vignerons Libres are smugglers and tax evaders posing as defenders of the terroir and champions of regional autonomy.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: The Préfet was once a great man, but power and complacency have corrupted his terroir. Yet we remain loyal, in memory of past reforms, and to serve the Vignoble.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: The Syndicat des Artisans is gracious enough to permit me to share the inner discipline and procedural harmony of the martial arts.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant
